text: sorry to be that guy, but the internet has been turning off and on for me randomly yesterday and today. gettin frustratin.
yeah i am having issues as well
<@U0H4SJN11> can you refresh the access points that affect 390 please?
Sure
check to make sure we dont have google hangouts first
one happening in echo
please hold
k
In holding pattern. (also one in courtyard)
also, that might be part of the problem. get those hangouts on the wired network if possible.
we are on hangout now
wired
but all other wireless is broken
k can hangout people notify this channel when they are off?
trying to hold steady for an hour

one thought — could we do some testing to see what actually crashes our network? We’ve had many examples in this week where hangouts or internet drops entirely. Wondering if it’s when we have multiple hangouts or what. Hoping to do that when we’re nto actively on client calls
we can try but we have tried to load our network to failure many times. the failure conditions emerge in circumstances that prevent clarity, when the office is busy.
more frequent restarts are correlated with better resilience.
OS updates seem to cause problems, that usually get improved on the next round of firmware updates. but its all very qualitative and unsatisfying.
hangouts are a network punk, and we know that.
We could also do some testing with some new routers that we might want in Arya. More network analytics might be useful.
sub effect that’s happened 3 times this week mid hangout — the machines log the conference rooms out
(which #3 just happened!)
echo hangout done
is the internet acting better for people right now?
ok
We *NEED* to make conference calls a priority. ASAP. We got logged out of our hangout, midhangout
this is now the *FOURTH* time this has happened this week.
we’re back on the hangout now, but ASAP we must make this a priority to figure out what is going on with our network. Not for Arya. For here.

Whatever the solution is — we have two problems that I’ve seen: 

- Network drops entirely
- Conference rooms log out after X amount of time in a hangout.
Of note for the logout scenario - we are hard wired in Courtyard.
Logout happens on a schedule, we'd need to log back in on a scheduled thing
Can just add it to like Monday morning roundup
i’ve not noted if logout happens at any particular time
echo and courtyard logged out at different times
right, cause they're probably logged in at different times
cool. so how do we fix
I think for the moment, we just make it someone's responsibility to logout/login all conf setups once a week
and make sure the password is in autofill incase it comes up again
For hangouts, have we tried to limit video bandwidth during the call?

hey sorry i haven’t been following this conversation in realtime. we didn’t reboot the routers the last two weekends, which is a practice that seems to keep the doctor away. we can take a crack at formalizing that process. the logout/login as well.
appreciated. I’m happy to volunteer to do any of the logging in/out

I have scheduled a meeting tomorrow afternoon at 3 pm for some unlucky “volunteers” to help formulate problems and solutions we can shoulder. We can’t rely on Josh’s weekend network tidying to be the only thing between sanity and the abyss, among other reasons because that’s just not fair. So we will work out something, and it will probably work moderately well. :slightly_smiling_face: If anyone else wants to contribute to IT work of the darkest order, please let me know, you’ll be happily invited.
since I cant make the meeting tomorrow at 3pm, I suggest a rotating list of people with IT duties to perform said tasks at the end of the work day on friday
that way it is ready to go monday morning
Josh restarted stuff. If you experience issues tomorrow please notify this channel
